sub_title: Executive Director at GNF on Law, History, Politics and Society in the Context of Mass Atrocities
summary: For many years I have combined my work at the University of Amsterdam with research at the International Criminal Tribunal for former Yugoslavia. As member of Prosecution's Leadership Research Team I dealt with identifying, acquiring and analysing evidence relevant for the accountability of the political leaders indicted by ICTY. This resulted in academic research at the intersection of history, law and politics and the book on the unfinished trial of Slobodan Milošević. My academic background and the practical application of my skills at the UNICTY inspired me to co-found the Geoffrey Nice Foundation on Law, History, Politics and Society of which I have been Executive Director. The major objective of the GNF is to bring the law closer to the society. Every year we organise an interdisciplinary Master Class for for young professionals from different parts of the world and engage in a dialogue about the mechanisms of accountability, reparations and history writing in the post-conflict societies.
